DataElement.preferredName: Needle Biopsy Invasive Prostate Carcinoma Total Neoplastic Core Length Float
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Sum of linear measurements of invasive prostate carcinoma in all involved needle biopsy cores.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Needle Biopsy Invasive Prostate Carcinoma Total Tumor Tissue Length
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Removal and examination of tissue obtained through a transdermal needle inserted into the specific region, organ, or tissue being analyzed.:definition pending_Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.:definition pending:The linear extent in space from one end to the other.  Often used synonymously with distance.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Removal and examination of tissue obtained through a transdermal needle inserted into the specific region, organ, or tissue being analyzed.:definition pending

Concepts.definition: The removal of a tissue sample using a needle, for microscopic examination.
A carcinoma that is not confined to the prostatic epithelium but has spread to the surrounding stroma of the prostate gland.  The vast majority of invasive prostate carcinomas are adenocarcinomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.:definition pending:The linear extent in space from one end to the other.  Often used synonymously with distance.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to an entirety or whole, also constituting the full quantity or extent; complete; derived by addition.

Tissue sample that contains an abnormal cellular infiltrate forming a solid mass. The abnormal cellular component can be benign or malignant. Tumor samples are obtained for microscopic examination and/or molecular analysis.
The linear extent in space from one end of something to the other end, or the extent of something from beginning to end.
